column4: Hello, a friend of mine needs to find out his CPU temperature. How would he go about doing this in Ubuntu?
you can use a panel applet
How would you use a panel applet? Is there one specifically?
actually i think i installed extra panel applets, but u should be able to see it in system monitor
dont u have dhcp?
Yes, however, its a server, and its connected to a router. It needs to use a static IP, right?
it doesnt HAVE to, and i dont really know how to set up a static cuz ive never had to
ifconfig --help    should get you a start
I already am using the IP configuration, the information I originally sent over this channel (the first string of text) contained the information I didnt understand
can your router give it a static address based on its mac?
Probably
I can try
ctrl+c
it beeped at me... Ill just open another terminal
sudo tasksel install lamp-server returns Aotutyde fauked (100)
I think its because I have a few things running in the background... and I probably shouldent
How do I end a terminal (number 2 specifically)
click the close button
Its not graphical
I cant, a terminal "froze" at a screen, can I logout terminal 2 from another terminal?
